class cortex.models.distributions.Distribution(dim, name='distribution', must_sample=False, scale=1, **kwargs)¶

Bases: cortex.models.Layer

Distribution parent class.

Not meant to be used alone, use subclass.

has_kl¶

bool, convenience for if distribution subclass has exact KL.

is_continuous¶

bool, whether distribution is continuous (as opposed to discrete).

dim¶

int, dimension of distribution.

must_sample¶

bool, whether sampling is required for calculating density.

scale¶

int, scaling for distributions whose probs are higher order, such as Gaussian, which has mu and sigma.

f_sample¶

function (optional), sampling function.

f_neg_log_prob¶

function (optional), negative log probability funciton.

f_entropy¶

function (optional), entropy function.

entropy(p=None)¶

Entropy function.

get_center(p)¶

Center of the distribution.

get_energy_bias(x, z)¶

For use in RBMs and other energy based models

get_params()¶

Fetches distribution parameters.

get_prob()¶

Returns single tensory from params.

has_kl = False
is_continuous = False
kl_divergence(q)¶

KL divergence function.

neg_log_prob(x, p=None, sum_probs=True)¶

Negative log probability.

sample(n_samples, p=None)¶

Samples from distribution.

scale_for_energy_model(x, *params)¶

Scales input for energy based models.

set_params()¶
step_neg_log_prob(x, *params)¶

Step negative log probability for scan.

cortex.models.distributions.make_conditional(C)¶

Conditional distribution.

Conditional distributions do not own their parameters, they are given, such as from an MLP.

Parameters:C – Distribution subclass.
Returns:Conditional subclass.

cortex.models.gru module¶

Module for GRU layers

class cortex.models.gru.GRU(dim_in, dim_hs, input_net_aux=None, name='gru', **kwargs)¶

Bases: cortex.models.rnn.RNN

call_seqs(x, condition_on, level, *params)¶
static factory(data_iter=None, dim_in=None, dim_out=None, dim_hs=None, i_net=None, a_net=None, o_net=None, c_net=None, **kwargs)¶

Factory for creating MLPs for GRU and returning instance.

Convenience to quickly create MLPs from dictionaries, linking all relevent dimensions and distributions.

Parameters:
  • dim_in – int, input dimention.
  • dim_hs – list of int, dimensions of reccurent units.
  • data_iter – Dataset object, provides dimension and distribution info.
  • dim_out – int (optional), output dimension. If not provided, assumed to be dim_in.
  • i_net – dict, input network args.
  • o_net – dict, output network args.
  • c_net – dict, conditional network args.
Returns:

GRU object
Return type:

GRU
get_aux_args(*args)¶
get_conditional_args(*args)¶

Returns MLP parameters for scan.

Initialize GRU parameters.

Returns preact for sampling step.

cortex.models.helmholtz module¶

Module for Helmhotlz machines.

SBNs, GBNs, etc. Networks with DARN components should also be trainable with this class.

class cortex.models.helmholtz.Helmholtz(posterior, conditional, prior, name=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: cortex.models.Layer

Generic Helmholtz machine class.

SBNs, GBNs (VAE), and other prior distributions supported here. Only single latent layer for this class. See DeepHelmholtz. Use Helmholtz.factory for simple SBN.

posterior¶

MLP, approximate posterior distribution network. (aka inference net or recognition net)

conditional¶

MLP, conditional network.

prior¶

Distribution, prior distribution of latent variables.

static factory(dim_h, data_iter=None, distributions=None, dims=None, **kwargs)¶

Factory for forming conditional, posterior, and prior.

Parameters:
  • dim_h – int, latent dimension.
  • data_iter – Dataset class.
  • **kwargs – kwargs for mlp_factory
Returns:

Helmholtz object.
generate_from_latent(h)¶

Generates an image from a latent state.

get_center(p)¶

Returns the center of the conditional distribution.

get_params()¶

Get model parameters.

get_posterior_params(*params)¶

Get the posterior params for scan.

get_prior_params(*params)¶

Get the prior params for scan.

init_inference_samples(size)¶

Initializes the samples for inference.

l2_decay(rate)¶

Get L2 decay costs.

log_marginal(y, h, py, q)¶

Computes the approximate log marginal.

Uses log sum p / q - log N

Parameters:
  • y – T.tensor, target values.
  • h – T.tensor, latent samples.
  • py – T.tesnor, conditional density p(y | h)
  • q – approximate posterior q(h | y)
Returns:

approximate log marginal.
static mlp_factory(dim_h, data_iter=None, distributions=None, dims=None, prior=None, rec_args=None, gen_args=None)¶

Factory for forming conditional, posterior, and prior.

Parameters:
  • dim_h – int, latent dimension.
  • data_iter – Dataset class (optional). Must be provided if distributions and dims are not
  • distributions – dict (optional). keys are data mode names, values are str for distribution (see distributions.py)
  • dims – dict (optional). Keys are data mode names, values are int.
  • prior – str or Distribution object (optional), type (str) or instance of prior. See distributions.py.
  • rec_args – dict (optional), arguments for approximate posterior.
  • gen_args – dict (optional), arguments for conditional network.
Returns:

MLP. posterior: MLP. prior: Distribution.
Return type:

conditional
p_y_given_h(h, *params)¶

p(y | h) for scan.

sample_from_prior(n_samples=100)¶

Samples from the prior distribution.

set_params()¶
set_tparams()¶
visualize_latents()¶

Visualizes influence of latent variables on input space.

Takes the difference between “on” and “off” units (defined by prior). See distributions.py for details.

cortex.models.helmholtz.unpack(dim_h=None, prior=None, rec_args=None, gen_args=None, data_iter=None, **model_args)¶

Function to unpack pretrained model into fresh Helmholtz class.

See Helmholtz.factory for details.

class cortex.models.mlp.MLP(dim_in, dim_out, dim_h=None, n_layers=None, dim_hs=None, f_sample=None, f_neg_log_prob=None, f_entropy=None, h_act='T.nnet.sigmoid', distribution='binomial', out_act=None, distribution_args={}, name='MLP', **kwargs)¶

Bases: cortex.models.Layer

Multilayer perceptron model.

dim_in¶

int, input dimension.

dim_out¶

int, output dimension.

distribution¶

Distribution (optional), distribution of output. Used for sampling, density calculations, etc.

dim_h¶

int (optional): dimention of hidden layer.

dim_hs¶

list of ints (optional), for multiple hidden layers.

n_layers¶

int, number of output and hidden layers.

cortex.models.rbm module¶

Module for RBM class

class cortex.models.rbm.RBM(dim_v, dim_h, mean_image=None, name='rbm', v_dist='binomial', h_dist='binomial', **kwargs)¶

Bases: cortex.models.Layer

RBM class.

Currently supports only binary hidden units.

h_dist¶

Distribution, conditional distribution of hiddens.

v_dist¶

Distribution, conditional distribution of visibles.

dim_h¶

int, number of hidden units.

dim_v¶

int, number of visible units.

W¶

T.tensor, weights

log_Z¶

T.tensor, current approximation of the log marginal.

std_log_Z¶

T.tensor, current std of the approximate log marginal.

mean_image¶

T.tensor, used for marginal approximation.

ais(K, M)¶

Performs AIS to estimate the log of the partition function, Z.

Only works for Binomial / Binomial.

Parameters:
  • int. Number of annealing steps. (K,) –
  • M – int. Number of annealing runs.
Returns:

T.tensor. d_logz: T.tensor. var_dlogz: T.tensor. log_ws: T.tensor, log weights. xs[-1]: T.tensor, samples.
Return type:

log_za
energy(v, h)¶

Energy of a visible, hidden configuration.

estimate_nll(X)¶

Estimate the NLL using the estimate of log_Z.

static factory(dim_v=None, dim_h=None, **kwargs)¶

Convenience factory method

free_energy(x)¶

Free energy function

free_energy_h(h)¶

Free energy function for hidden states.

Convenience negative log prob function.

l2_decay(gamma)¶
ph_v(x)¶

Function for probability of h given v

pv_h(h)¶

Function for probility of v given h

reconstruct(x)¶

Reconstruction error (cross entropy).

Performs one step of Gibbs.

Parameters:x – T.tensor, input
Returns:
T.tensor, visible conditional probability density from
hidden sampled from p(h | x)
Return type:pv
sample(h0, n_steps=1)¶

Gibbs sampling function.

Sampling starts from hidden state (arbitrary design choice).

Parameters:
  • h0 – T.tensor, Initial hidden layer state.
  • n_steps – int, number of Gibbs steps.
Returns:

OrderedDict, all of the visible and hidden states as well

as the probability densities from Gibbs sampling.

updates: OrderedUpdates, from scan
Return type:

results
set_params()¶
set_tparams()¶
split_params(*params)¶
step_free_energy(x, beta, *params)¶

Step free energy function.

step_free_energy_h(h, beta, *params)¶

Step free energy function for hidden states.

step_gibbs(r_h, r_v, h, *params)¶

Step Gibbs sample

step_gibbs_ais(r_h_a, r_h_b, r_v, v, beta, W_a, b_a, c_a, W_b, b_b, c_b)¶

Step Gibbs sample for AIS.

Only works for Binomial / Binomial Gibbs sampling for the transition operator that keeps p*_{k-1} invariant.

Parameters:
  • r_h_a – T.tensor, random tensor for sampling h_a.
  • r_h_b – T.tensor, random tensor for sampling h_b.
  • r_v – T.tensor, random tensor for sampling v.
  • v – T.tensor, input to T_{k-1}(.|v_{k-1})
  • beta – float, annealing factor.
  • b_a, c_a (W_a,) – T.tensor, parameters of RBM a.
  • b_b, c_b (W_b,) – T.tensor, parameters of RBM b.
Returns:

T.tensor, sample v_k sim T_{k-1}(.|v_{k-1}).
Return type:

v
step_ph_v(x, *params)¶

Step function for probability of h given v

step_pv_h(h, *params)¶

Step function for cacluating probility of v given h.

step_sh_v(r, x, *params)¶

Step function for sampling h given v

step_sv_h(r, h, *params)¶

Step function for samples from v given h

update_partition_function(K=10000, M=100)¶

Updates the partition function.

Only works for Binomial / Binomial.

Parameters:
  • K – int, number of AIS steps.
  • M – int, number of AIS runs.
Returns:

OrderedDict, results from AIS. updates: OrderedUpdates, updates for partition function.
Return type:

results

cortex.models.rnn module¶

Module for RNN layers.

class cortex.models.rnn.RNN(dim_in, dim_hs, dim_out=None, conditional=None, input_net=None, output_net=None, name='rnn', **kwargs)¶

Bases: cortex.models.Layer

RNN class.

Implements a generic multilayer RNN.

dim_in¶

int, input dimension.

dim_out¶

int, output dimension.

dim_hs¶

list of int: dimenstions of recurrent units.

n_layers¶

int, number of recurrent layers. Should match len(dim_hs).

input_net¶

MLP object, MLP to feed input into recurrent layers.

output_net¶

MLP object, MLP to read from recurrent layers.

condtional¶

MLP object (optional), MLP to condition output on previous output.

call_seqs(x, condition_on, level, *params)¶

Prepares the input for __call__

energy(X, h0s=None)¶

Negative log probability of data point.

static factory(data_iter=None, dim_in=None, dim_out=None, dim_hs=None, i_net=None, o_net=None, c_net=None, **kwargs)¶

Factory for creating MLPs for RNN and returning .

Convenience to quickly create MLPs from dictionaries, linking all relevent dimensions and distributions.

Parameters:
  • dim_in – int, input dimention.
  • dim_hs – list of int, dimensions of reccurent units.
  • data_iter – Dataset object, provides dimension and distribution info.
  • dim_out – int (optional), output dimension. If not provided, assumed to be dim_in.
  • i_net – dict, input network args.
  • o_net – dict, output network args.
  • c_net – dict, conditional network args.
Returns:

RNN object
Return type:

RNN

get_input_args(*args)¶

get_net_params()¶

Returns MLP parameters for scan.

Returns parameters for scan.

get_recurrent_args(*args)¶
get_sample_params()¶

Returns parameters used for sampling.

l2_decay(rate)¶

L2 decay.

neg_log_prob(x, p)¶

Negative log prob function.

sample(x0=None, h0s=None, n_samples=10, n_steps=10, condition_on=None, debug=False)¶

Samples from an initial state.

Parameters:
  • x0 – T.tensor (optional), initial input state.
  • h0 – T.tensor (optional), initial recurrent state.
  • n_samples – int (optional), if no x0 or h0, used to initial batch. Number of chains.
  • n_steps – int, number of sampling steps.
Returns:

OrderedDict of samples, probs, recurrent states, etc. updates: OrderedUpdates.
Return type:

results
set_net_params()¶

Initialize MLP parameters.

set_params()¶

Initialize RNN parameters.

set_tparams()¶

Sets and returns theano parameters.

step_call(x, m, h0s, *params)¶

Step version of __call__ for scan

step_sample(*params)¶

RNN step sample function for scan.

A convenience function for scan, this method samples the output given the input, returning the current states and sample.

step_sample_preact(*params)¶

Returns preact for sampling step.

class cortex.models.rnn.SimpleRNN(dim_in, dim_h, **kwargs)¶

Bases: cortex.models.rnn.RNN

Simple RNN class, single hidden layer.

Wraps RNN but with a single hidden layer in __init__ instead of list.

energy(X, h0=None)¶

Energy function.

static factory(data_iter=None, dim_in=None, dim_out=None, dim_h=None, i_net=None, o_net=None, c_net=None, **kwargs)¶

Convenience factory for SimpleRNN (see RNN.factory).

sample(x0=None, h0=None, **kwargs)¶

Sample the SimpleRNN (see RNN.sample).

cortex.models.rnn.init_h(h_init, X, batch_size, models, **h_args)¶

Initializes the RNN hidden state.

Parameters:
  • h_init – str. Type of initialization.
  • X – 3D T.tensor. Input tensor for initialization through MLP.
  • batch_size – int
  • models – list of Layer, pulls ‘h_net’ for initialization (TODO change this).
  • **h_args – kwargs for different initializations.
Returns:

3D Tensor of initializations. Full 3D tensor returned to train h_net.
Return type:

h0s
